channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2024021499
item.description:
Report X-2024021499

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The inner plastic container/bag is very thin and was punctured allowing the acetone to slowly leak from the inner packaging and absorb into the outer packaging until it was soggy and noticeable. It was then placed in a lined hazmat tote and brought to the designated damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: The inner plastic container is too thin and is easily punctured. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Just placed in a lined hazmat tote to contain the leaked liquid.

item.title: Report X-2024021196
item.description:
Report X-2024021196

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being unloaded when it was noticed that the bottom of the box was slightly soggy. It was then place in a lined hazmat tote and taken to the designated damaged hazmat area. DescribePack: The bottles of liquid have loose caps that are allowing liquid to slowly leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upright which stopped any further leaking.

item.title: Report X-2024020903
item.description:
Report X-2024020903

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in corrugated carton. Loose cap came off one jug and contents spilled, soiling other jugs and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024021494
item.description:
Report X-2024021494

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. came the Hub QA chute and I noticed outer carton was wet and notified Sort Manager immediately, stating that unloaders are placing hazmats in sorter and gave him trailer # that it was unloaded from he got with manager to make sure manager has in their presort meetings about hazmats going into sorter, DescribePack: All closures had come loose and 3 bottles leaked out a small amount of liquid but 1 bottle leaked out more than the others in shipment DurationRel: 14 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.

item.title: Report E-2024020516
item.description:
Report E-2024020516

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN3093 Ferric Nitrate Solution 41% release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 ounces of product released to the top of the poly tote and tote body due to a loose and crooked cap. The contractors re-secured the cap back onto the tote and wiped down the poly tote for shipment on. No waste was generated.

item.title: Report X-2024021529
item.description:
Report X-2024021529

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called upon an Admin for assistance in containing the shipment. DescribePack: One of the four bottles leaked contents due to a loose lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous material spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024020962
item.description:
Report X-2024020962

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was accidentally sent up into the sorter. A facer removed it from the sorter, but had dropped it in the process. Shortly thereafter, the facers noticed a wet spot on the exterior packaging. An Admin was called for assistance in containing the leaking shipment. DescribePack: The leak seems to be stemming from the bottom of the drum's sidewall. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous materials spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

  • Description: 1. X-2024021056 RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO SPILL LOCATION AND ARRIVED WEARING PROPER PPE. PACKAGE AND SPILLED CONTENTS WERE CONTAINED FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING BY RESPONDER. 2. X-2024021057 RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO SPILL LOCATION AND ARRIVED WEARING PROPER PPE. PACKAGE AND SPILLED CONTENTS WERE CONTAINED FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND WERE TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products, LLC driver inadvertently dropped a tote containing Organic Peroxide. The tote was ruptured and approximately 250 gallons of Organic Peroxide was released. Ambipar Response was dispatched to the scene and handled the remediation.
